body.para: Getting there, now Leo starts, clicking on a menu produces the following message in an "Error in background function" window (the menus do work in spite of this message, IE File->New opens a new Leo file)

ktenney@itstation3:~/code/bzr/leo-editor$ python /home/ktenney/code/bzr/leo-editor/leo/core/runLeo.py reading settings in /home/ktenney/code/bzr/leo-editor/leo/config/leoSettings.leo reading settings in /home/ktenney/myLeoSettings.leo reading /home/ktenney/.leoRecentFiles.txt @enabled-plugins found in leoSettings.leo rst3 plugin: SilverCity not loaded image.py: can not import ImageTk can not load enabled plugin: image <type 'exceptions.KeyError'> Exception in Tk callback Function: <function bindCallback at 0x1fee6e0> (type: <type 'function'>) Args: (<Tkinter.Event instance at 0x1e7c128>,) Event type: FocusOut (type num: 10) Traceback (innermost last): File
"/home/ktenney/src/bzr/leo-editor/leo/extensions/Pmw/Pmw_1_3/lib/PmwBase.py", line 1747, in __call__ None File "/home/ktenney/code/bzr/leo-editor/leo/core/leoCommands.py", line 6136, in bindCallback val = func(event) File "/home/ktenney/code/bzr/leo-editor/leo/core/leoTkinterFrame.py", line 81, in onFocusOut c.k.showStateAndMode(w=g.app.gui.get_focus(c)) File "/home/ktenney/code/bzr/leo-editor/leo/core/leoTkinterGui.py", line 473, in get_focus return c.frame.top.focus_displayof() File "/usr/lib/python2.5/lib-tk/Tkinter.py", line 460, in focus_displayof return self._nametowidget(name) File "/usr/lib/python2.5/lib-tk/Tkinter.py", line 1076, in nametowidget w = w.children[name] <type 'exceptions.KeyError'>: '#26801432#37367752'

================================================ Event contents: char: ?? delta: 0 height: ?? keycode: ?? keysym: ?? keysym_num: ?? num: ?? send_event: False serial: 3978 state: ?? time: ?? type: 10 widget: .26801432.32873432.32873936.32874152.33103456.33103816.body-pane width: ?? x: ?? x_root: ?? y: ?? y_root: ??

quote.quotepara: On Tue, May 20, 2008 at 10:41 AM, Kent Tenney <kten...@gmail.com> wrote:

tries to start Leo. (I'm still getting the TK traceback) File "/home/ktenney/code/bzr/leo-editor/leo/core/leoTkinterFrame.py", line 634, in createTkTreeCanvas c.bind2(canvas,"<ButtonPress>",mapWheel,add=1) TypeError: bind2() got an unexpected keyword argument 'add'
Sorry about that. I really have got to get Linux working again. I've just pushed an attempted fix. Please let me know how it works.
